page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: We went to interview Mrs Aitken of Riccarton farm. The farm is the largest in the area.Mrs Aitken could not tell us its size.The stock total is two thousand animals.The farm is mixed. The Aitkens own Riccarton hills,North and South Mains as well as Cairn Papple and the Longmuir plantation. The fields nearest to them are the Camp field and the Hen field.The Camp field was used during the war as a camp for British soldiers. The farmhouse is about one hundred years old.It was built by Lady Hamilton when the old one was knocked down.From the kitchen window Mrs Aitken sees a large hill where badgers and foxes roam. Some interesting features are two volcanic plugs. The employees number ten.
